WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump said Friday he expects to "quickly" revoke the security clearance for the Justice Department official whose wife worked for the firm involved in producing the dossier on Trump's ties to Russia.
Ohr's wife, Nellie, worked for Fusion GPS during the campaign — something Trump has tweeted about to highlight his assertions of political bias behind the Russia investigation.
The opposition research firm hired former British spy Christopher Steele during the 2016 presidential campaign to compile the dossier.
Ohr has come under Republican scrutiny for his contacts to Glenn Simpson, co-founder of Fusion GPS.
Asked about Ohr's security clearance, Trump said: "I suspect I'll be taking it away very quickly.
For him to be in the Justice Department and doing what he did, that is a disgrace."
